clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence of Metabolic Syndrome in Atahualpa
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Prevalence of Metabolic Syndrome in Atahualpa Residents Aged 40 Years or More.

brief_summary.textblock: A recent epidemiologic survey demonstrated a high prevalence of type 2 diabetes mellitus in Atahualpa residents. Now, the investigators attempt to evaluate the prevalence of the metabolic syndrome in adults aged 40 years or more living in this rural village of coastal Ecuador.

detailed_description.textblock: Several studies have shown that the occurrence of the metabolic syndrome is a risk factor for the development of cerebrovascular and ischemic heart disease. To evaluate the prevalence of the metabolic syndrome, we will invite all Atahualpa residents aged 40 years or more to participate in this study. For the purposes of this study we will obtain the waist circumference of all individuals, will measure their blood pressure using a standard protocol, and will take a blood sample to determine fasting glucose levels, HDL cholesterol levels, triglyceride levels, and plasma insulin levels.

primary_outcome.description: determination of the metabolic syndrome in subjects aged 40 years or more

secondary_outcome.description: Blood will be taken to evaluate the ADN pattern of this population, to compare with other Amerindian populations with a proven high prevalence of diabetes mellitus and metabolic syndrome

other_outcome.measure: determination of the prevalence of hyperinsulinemia
other_outcome.description: plasma insulin levels will be determined

arm_group.description: all Atahualpa residents aged 40 years or more

intervention.description: a blood sample will be obtained to measure glucose, HDL cholesterol, triglycerides, and for genetic testing

study_pop.textblock: all Atahualpa residents aged 40 years or more
